title: Technician
body:
<<if !visited("Technician.GiveBook")>>
    [[Technician.GiveBook]]
<<else>>
    Okay, last try didn't work out so well,
    can we just try that again?
    [[Technician.AskForPicture]]
<<endif>>

title: Technician.GiveBook
body:
By the breath of James Watt! Just take this horrible book!
I've never read anything so ridiculous in all of my life.
A human person who turns into an insect?
And don't get me started on the daddy issues.
It's the worst thing I have ever touched in my life.
-> Okay I'll take it.
    Thank you you dear soul!
    You woudn't believe the pain you're saving me.
-> Then I don't want it either.
    I'm afraid you don't have a choice here,
    take it, throw it away, whatever.
    But I can't guarantee my personal wellbeing in proximity to this book.
Now that this is done with, can I ask you for another favour?
I'd absolutely love to draw a picture of you,
just a reminder of the day I saw your intricate design.
[[Technician.AskForPicture]]

title: Technician.AskForPicture
body:
Just keep still like you are now.
I should be able to sketch you in about 30 seconds.
But you can't move a single step, otherwise I have to start all over again.
I assume you know how drawing works.
<<StartDrawing Technician>>
